guide.welcome.title: Welcome to OneClick Connect
guide.welcome.description: Welcome to OneClick Connect Game Accelerator! This is a simple setup guide. If you're already familiar with game acceleration basics, you can close this guide and start using the app.
guide.sider.title: Control Panel
guide.sider.description: The left side is the game accelerator's control panel where you can quickly switch acceleration modes, view connection status, and access various settings.
guide.card.title: Function Cards
guide.card.description: Click on the left function cards to jump to corresponding pages. You can drag and drop cards to customize the display order for quick access to frequently used features.
guide.main.title: Main Area
guide.main.description: The right side is the main area displaying detailed settings and status information for the currently selected function.
guide.profile.title: Game Node Management
guide.profile.description: The node management card shows current game acceleration node information. Click to enter and manage different acceleration server routes.
guide.import.title: Import Game Config
guide.import.description: OneClick Connect supports various game acceleration configuration import methods. Enter your acceleration service subscription link here and click import to start enjoying game acceleration services.
guide.substore.title: Sub-Store
guide.substore.description: OneClick Connect deeply integrates with Sub-Store subscription management tool. You can use this feature to manage configurations from multiple game acceleration service providers and easily switch between different acceleration routes.
guide.localProfile.title: Local Config
guide.localProfile.description: Click '+' to import local configuration files or create custom acceleration configurations to meet advanced users' personalized acceleration needs.
guide.sysproxy.title: System Proxy
guide.sysproxy.description: After importing acceleration configuration, the acceleration service is running in the background. You can enable system proxy to let most applications and games automatically use the acceleration service.
guide.sysproxySetting.title: System Proxy Settings
guide.sysproxySetting.description: Configure system proxy related settings and choose proxy mode here. For Windows games that don't follow system proxy, you can use 'UWP Tool' to remove local loopback restrictions.
guide.tun.title: Virtual Network Acceleration
guide.tun.description: Virtual network card mode is the core feature of game acceleration, allowing all network traffic to go through the acceleration channel, especially suitable for optimizing various online games.
guide.tunSetting.title: Virtual Network Settings
guide.tunSetting.description: Configure virtual network card related parameters here. OneClick Connect has completely solved permission issues. If the virtual network card doesn't work properly, try resetting the firewall or manual authorization then restart.
guide.override.title: Advanced Config
guide.override.description: OneClick Connect provides powerful custom configuration features to personalize acceleration rules, such as adding game-specific routing rules and custom node grouping to meet professional user needs.
guide.dns.title: DNS Acceleration
guide.dns.description: The software enables DNS acceleration by default, which can effectively reduce domain name resolution latency in games. You can adjust custom DNS settings in application settings if needed.
guide.end.title: Setup Complete
guide.end.description: Now you understand the basic usage of the game accelerator. Go import your acceleration configuration and start enjoying smooth gaming experience! Join our official Telegram group for technical support if you encounter any issues.
